title: Roll out the red carpet
caption: Hollywood's big night
desc: It's Oscars night in Tinseltown, so take a moment to gaze over Los Angeles with an unfamiliar view of a famous US landmark. The Hollywood Sign originally read 'Hollywoodland' when it was erected in 1923 and was festooned with light bulbs to advertise a property development. But within a few years, as the silent-film era gave way to 'talkies', the sign evolved into a popular tourist attraction. Falling into disrepair in ensuing decades (at the peak of its decay, the sign was missing its third 'O' altogether) the original was demolished and a sturdier version built in 1978.
